intro: Crypsinus hirtellus, commonly known as the hairy crypsinus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in its native habitat. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and numerous stamens. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks.
